description: TO AMEND THE HOUSE RESOLUTION TO AUTHORIZE THE PAYMENT OF $11,000,000 FOR THE PURCHASE OF LOUISIANA FROM FRANCE IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE CONVENTION OF APRIL 30, 1803; BY REQUESTING THE PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES TO LAY BEFORE THE HOUSE A COPY OF THE TRATY OF OCT

TO DISCHARGE THE COMMITTEE OF THE WHOLE FROM FURTHER CONSIDERATION OF THE SENATE RESOLUTION CONCERNING AMENDING THE CONSTITUTION, SINCE SAID RESOLUTION WAS NOT TRANSMITTED BY A CONSTITUTIONAL NUMBER OF SENATORS.

TO REJECT THE BILL TO PROVIDE FOR THE SETTLEMENT OF SUNDRY CLAIMS TO LANDS WITHIN THE MISSISSIPPI TERRITORY.

TO AMEND THE RESOLUTION CONCERNING THE IMPEACHMENT AGAINST JUDGE CHASE OF THE SUPREME COURT, BY DELETING THE FOLLOWING SECTION: "THAT THE SAID SAMUEL CHASE HAS ENDEAVORED TO COVER THE HIGH CRIMES AND MISDEMEANORS LAID TO HIS CHARGE BY EVASIVE INSINUATION AND MISREPRESENTATION OF FACTS, THAT THE SAID ANSWER DOES GIVE A GLOSS COLORING, UTTERLY FALSE AND UNTRUE, TO THE VARIOUS CRIMINAL MATTERS CONTAINED IN SAID ARTICLE."

TO AGREE TO THE REPLICATION, "THAT THEY HAVE CONSIDERED THE ANSWER OF SAMUEL CHASE AND FIND THAT HE HAS ENDEAVORED TO COVER THE CRIMES AND MISDEMEANORS LAID TO HIS CHARGE AND THAT THIS INFORMATION BE TRANSMITTED TO THE SENATE."

THAT THE HOUSE AGREE TO THE PRINTING OF DOCUMENTS FROM THE SECRETARY OF STATE GIVING EVIDENCE OF TITLE TO LANDS CLAIMED UNDER ANY ACT OF THE STATE OF GA., PASSED OR PRETENDED TO BE PASSED IN THE YEARS 1789 AND 1795.  (P. 1197)
TO AGREE TO THE RESOLUTION TO DIRECT THE CLERK TO ADVERTISE FOR PROPOSALS FOR PRINTING AND STATIONERY AFTER THE PRESENT SESSION OF CONGRESS.

TO CONCUR IN THE AMENDMENT TO S. 8, AN ACT FURTHER PROVIDING FOR THE GOVERNMENT OF THE TERRITORY OF NEW ORLEANS SAID AMENDMENT PROVIDING THAT THE COUNCIL AND REPRESENTATIVES OF SAID TERRITORY SHALL NOMINATE PERSONS TO BE APPOINTED AS GOVERNOR.  (P. 1210)

TO REFER TO THE COMMITTEE OF THE WHOLE THE HOUSE CONCURRENT RESOLUTION THAT ALL UNITED STATES JUDGES SHALL BE REMOVED BY THE PRESIDENT ON THE JOINT ADDRESS OF CONGRESS REQUESTING THE SAME, REGARDLESS OF THE U.S. CONSTITUTION.  (P. 1213)
TO REFER TO COMMITTEE THE HOUSE CONCURRENT RESOLUTION TO ALLOW THE STATES TO RECALL ANY SENATOR ELECTED BY THEM.
TO MAKE THE HOUSE CONCURRENT RESOLUTION CONCERNING RECALL OF SENATORS, THE ORDER OF THE DAY THE FIRST MONDAY IN DECEMBER.  (P. 1214)
